summary: This is a transcript of a grand jury proceeding in the Southern District of New York on July 8, 2020. An Assistant United States Attorney presents a proposed superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell to correct two clerical errors (docket numbers) in the perjury counts, referencing testimony and evidence from the previous week. No new evidence or witnesses are presented.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the proposed superseding indictment being presented to the grand jury. She is charged in six counts, including perjury related to her 2016 deposition testimony.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by the AUSA when asking grand jurors if they have outside knowledge about the case involving him or Maxwell.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: Referenced as having given testimony to the grand jury the previous week, which was part of the evidence considered.

connections.description: Implied connection as the case involves both individuals; the AUSA groups them together when asking about grand jurors' outside knowledge.

events.title: Initial Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: An additional appearance for Ghislaine Maxwell is noted on this date under docket number 2018R01618.

events.title: Grand Jury Proceeding for Superseding Indictment
events.description: AUSA presents a proposed superseding indictment to correct clerical errors in the original indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The grand jury deliberates.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave deposition testimony in a civil case (docket 15 Civ. 7433). This testimony is the basis for one of the perjury charges.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave another deposition in the same civil case (docket 15 Civ. 7433). This testimony is the basis for a second perjury charge.

locations: United States Courthouse, 300 Quaroppas Street, White Plains, New York
keyFacts: The grand jury is presented with a superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell to correct two typographical errors in the docket numbers for the perjury counts (Counts Five and Six).
The corrected civil case docket number for Maxwell's 2016 depositions is 15 Civ. 7433, not 15 Civ. 7344 as originally stated.
No new evidence or witnesses are presented; the grand jury is to base its decision on the same evidence from the previous week, which included testimony from an FBI Special Agent.
Virtually all grand jurors indicated they had heard or read about Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein, or others related to the case prior to the proceeding.
The proceeding was brief, lasting approximately 9 minutes (from 10:05 a.m. to 10:14 a.m.).
